definition: Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: The inscription became a prelude of the surrender of Gu's military unit to the Qing army ten months later.
sentences.chinese: 題字成爲十個月後該部全體投降清軍的前奏曲。

sentences.english: The author make a study of the Qing Army dispatched to Tianjin.
sentences.chinese: 本文對派駐天津的清軍力量作了研究。

sentences.english: Thus no men of Qing army would risk crossing the Xiangjiang Riverand launching attacks on the west riverbank.
sentences.chinese: 由此，清軍再無人真正敢渡湘江向西岸進攻。

sentences.english: In the last years of the Ming Dynasty , General Hong Chengchou fought Qing's army.
sentences.chinese: 明清末年，大將洪承疇與清軍作戰，兵敗被俘。

sentences.english: The Qing army sent a letter to him to induce him to capitulate , promising to give him a high office and fat salary .
sentences.chinese: 清軍給史可法送來了勸降信，答應給他高官厚祿。

definition: Hunan army, irregular force formed in 1850s to fight the Taiping heavenly kingdom rebellion
governor general 总督 and inspector general 巡抚
Tang and Song dynasty provincial governor, in Tang times having military and civil authority, but only civil authority in Song
Eight-Nation Alliance, involved in a military intervention in northern China in 1900
Wu Sangui (1612-1678), Chinese general who let the Manchus into China and helped them establish the Qing Dynasty, later leading a revolt against Qing in an effort to start his own dynasty
Zhang Xianzhong (1606-1647), leader of a late-Ming peasant revolt
to go on a punitive expedition
